title: 113_s2114
content: The "Bond Transparency Act of 2014" requires disclosure of markup in riskless principal transactions in municipal securities. The Securities Exchange Act of 1934 is amended to include markup disclosure in riskless principal transactions for municipal securities. This defines a riskless principal transaction as when a broker buys or sells municipal securities for a customer order and then completes the order by buying or selling the securities to another person. The Securities Exchange Act of 1934 is amended to include markup disclosure in riskless principal transactions for municipal securities. This requires brokers to disclose the price difference to customers in writing for such transactions. SEC. 3. Markup disclosure required for riskless principal transactions in corporate debt securities. Section 15 of the Securities Exchange Act of 1934 is amended to include markup disclosure in riskless principal transactions for corporate debt securities. This subsection defines "specified debt security" as any security that evidences a liability of the issuer, including bonds, debentures, notes, or similar instruments. The Securities Exchange Act of 1934 is amended to include markup disclosure in riskless principal transactions for corporate debt securities. A "specified debt security" is defined as a United States dollar-denominated security issued by the United States or a foreign private issuer, or any other security identified by the Commission. Municipal securities are excluded from this definition. A "riskless principal transaction" refers to certain specified debt securities. The term 'riskless principal transaction' refers to a broker or dealer completing a customer order by buying or selling specified debt securities from another person while acting as principal. The broker or dealer must disclose this transaction. In a riskless principal transaction, the broker must disclose the price difference to the customer in writing before completing the transaction.
